main event: A series of unidentified flying object sightings were reported near Grand Forks, North Dakota, occurring mostly between April 1959 and April 1960.
interesting points: Numerous sightings were reported, with witnesses describing objects of various shapes including cigar-shaped and saucer-shaped., A farmer in the area reported seeing an object that resembled glass bulbs inside a ring, emitting a sound like a tractor backfiring., Several military personnel reported observing an elliptical object emitting a bright white light, with no sound or visible trail., One civilian reported seeing a bright object that hovered and then rapidly accelerated before disappearing., A letter was sent from Major Lawrence J. Tacker acknowledging the sighting but indicating insufficient information for analysis.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects of various shapes and sizes
witness description: The witnesses included local civilians, military personnel from Minot AFB, and at least one farmer.
